message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for a great price. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $120. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $60. Can you meet me in the middle?

I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $60. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit, so I'm offering the product to you for $100. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit too high. I'm willing to pay $70 for the product. Can you consider that?
I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob! I can see you're really interested in the product, and I'm willing to make a bit more of a concession. I'll meet you at $90. What do you think?
I'm getting close, but I think I can still get a better deal. I'm willing to pay $85 for the product. Can you meet me there?
I think we're really close now, Bob! I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll sell the product to you for $95. That's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make one more concession, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $80 for the product. That's the lowest I can go. Can you meet me there?
